alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 1:20PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ferry County through 145 PM PDT... At 120 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Sherman Pass, or near the Summit Trail burn scar, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Twin Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
